item.title: Public tree overgrowth outside 44 Oxhawth is endangering school children walking on footpath, 20th June
item.description:
This tree has not had its annual pruning by the council contractor and the branches and large leaves, including severe overhang on footpath, are now blocking the view of children walking to/from the primary schools at either end of Oxhawth Crescent plus any cars coming in/out of the properties nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxhawth Crescent, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bag dumped on the streets, 20th June
item.description:
The rubbish bag has not been picked up for 4 days, despite Hackney street cleaners being in the area. Now foxes are getting to the bag and are starting to spread its content.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tryon Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders are using an on road parking space on the street to keep their rubbish, 20th June
item.description:
Builders are using an on road parking space on the street to keep their rubbish - coned off so it look like a legitimate place for rubbish - instead of using a skip. they are taking up a parking space on a very busy street just off lordship lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Matham Grove, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 20.30 on June 19, all this came from the front yard of 55 Durley Road. The owners subsequently picked up the man they hired to move it,, 20th June
item.description:
